instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU Problem
threads.message:
Hello Everybody

This machine come with kernel panic problem when working graphics or video . I know this machine have GPU issue but extended warranty ended. 
Problem is looking like mid 2010 GPU switch problem. When started ASD kernel panic with this report;

[I]Video Controller External: Gmux switch to EG and verifiy (test 4) test will switch display to EG and Verify.[/I]

Replaced <CAPACITOR>C8930</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C8931</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C8943</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C8942</CAPACITOR> but nothing changed. 

Do you have any other suggestions before try the video chip?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU Problem
threads.message: Nop, apply some heat in the core of the chip (about 180Â°C)and try again, if it works is time ti replace GPU....

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU Problem
threads.message: Replace the GPU. Remove the glue on the VRAM!!

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU Problem
threads.message: Thank you Duke after replacement GPU problem solved.
